alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 9:33AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Guernsey, Monroe and Noble. Portions of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Fayette and Greene. Portions of West Virginia, including the following counties, Marion, Marshall, Monongalia, Preston and Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and snowmelt. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morgantown, Fairmont, New Martinsville, Westover, Woodsfield, Mannington, Star City, Caldwell, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Point Marion, Monongah, Granville, Pine Grove, Fairview, Hundred, Jacksonburg, Cassville and Brookhaven. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
